OOC: Hey, I just got a great idea. Let's restart the RPG! It'll be really c=
ool. Maybe we'll actually have factions back if we restart it. No kidding. =
I've been thinking of this all last night. I have only evil characters. The=
y have to attack some good guy characters. I make them attack Chivtrons. Wh=
y is that!? There are no other factions. Basically, we have about 4 faction=
s in the RPG, and none of them main factions, they're all side factions con=
sisting of about 3 or 4 characters each. I don't know, I just think that's =
pathetic. But, however, I think that it's only natural that people get atta=
ched to some characters. I got pretty attached to my old character Deemos. =
And now I'm pretty attached to my first characters that I didn't make up, t=
he Insecticons. I used to have the idea, that with alot of characters, I ca=
n make mine die all of the time and nobody would complain. I realized this =
after KSLawdogg complained on me, because I wouldn't make my character die =
after receiving a shot from his. I still think that it was utterly ridiculo=
us, but in that he did teach me two things. One, he was really cheap, much =
like I used to be, honestly, and two, I needed to make my characters die so=
oner or later, this wasn't first season Beast Wars. So I took hundreds of c=
haracters, ALMOST literally. They died here and there, but when I realized =
that most of them died at my character's hands, I realized that not alot of=
 people were RPing with me, so what was the point of the extra characters? =
Anyway, I grew to love ALOT of my characters. I let them all die over time,=
 mostly except for Deemos, but I still wanted to do my part in letting my c=
haracters die. But, with the rule of the character limit, it makes it a lit=
tle hard for me. I like to have some characters be consistent, and unfortun=
ately, that rule kind of binds me to only having the characters that I don'=
t want to die. Yes, I have characters that I don't want to die. WHAT!? I ha=
ve characters that I don't want to die. WHAT!? I said I have characters tha=
t I want to live. Anyway, my point is simple, I think. Or is it? Anyway, my=
 point is there, simple or not. People always get attached to a certain num=
ber of characters, especially under a certain limit. WHAT!? The limit. Howe=
ver, my OTHER point is. I think that the restart might be good for the RPG.=
 WHAT!? I think the restart is good. WHAT!? I like the restart...

  ----- =
Original Message ----- 
  From: Jonathan 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  S=
ent: Sunday, January 20, 2002 10:22 AM
  Subject: Re: All Read: Important

=

  Anyway I was going to rant on about how a sequel wouldn't be all that
  =
different from a restart but I figured why bother?

  When I hit the end of=
 my long typed out rant I hit the problem. The real
  one. Another person p=
osted that characters are not allowed to die
  currently...he is utterly in=
correct.

  The problem is the role-playing 101 aspect. People are given th=
e
  responsibility to judge how much damage they take...however as we've se=
en
  some can't role-play their way out of a wet paper bag let alone respon=
sibly
  judge how much damage their character takes. When a bot does get da=
maged
  what typically happens here?

  Here's the list:

  1) The enemy bo=
t suddenly becomes cockeyed unable to hit the broad side of a
  barn even i=
f he was a g1 and standing over it.

  2) The bot never gives chase to his =
prey. It always lets the long time
  character slip away.

  3) A short sta=
y (a few hours usually) in the CR chamber and any damage is
  completely go=
ne.

  4) The character "dies" but faked his death coming back as an enemy
=
  infiltrator.

  5) Character "dies" but an evil clone appears which after=
 various meeting
  with colleagues or "loved ones" turns good again. Person=
ality reverts to
  pre-evil clone.

  6) Character "dies" but is reborn as =
a more powerful offspring. Personality
  is hardly different.

  7) Charact=
er "dies" but the players 6 other characters cart it's blasted
  carcass ba=
ck to a lab where they resurrect him.

  8) Character "dies" replace with n=
ew bot same personality...eventually
  people will forget you died and you =
can go back to your old form.

  Since most will never let their "favorite"=
 character(s) die, I mean truly
  die, never come back like, there's really=
 very little new plotlines you can
  do with them without repeating rehashe=
d already done ones. Take for example
  the geotrons planing to attack the =
new cat faction....both factions will
  survive, I doubt either player who =
controls the majority of bots in either
  faction is gonna let their charac=
ters get anywhere near killed.

  And what's to stop this from happening if=
 a restart/sequel DOES occur? The
  role-playing by some will still stink, =
characters will still be incapable of
  dying and given another year or so =
all plotlines for THAT game will be
  starting to repeat. While I still do =
believe a restart/sequel is in order I
  think the role-playing problem nee=
ds addressing first to stop a repeat of
  what's happening to NBW.



  ---=
-- Original Message -----
  From: "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@...>
  To: <nb=
wrpg@yahoogroups.com>
  Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2002 5:57 AM
  Subject: A=
ll Read: Important


  > My appologies, Narrator, I actually missed your or=
iginal post.
  >
  > I find that Neo Beast Wars has been dragged on for too=
 long, and the
  > world is becoming clogged with bases among other things.=
 Ideas are
  > becoming exausted, if not completely exausted already. It se=
ems to
  > me that we are almost delaying the end of the rpg. If you've cre=
ated
  > one storyline that you like, is it not fair to say that you can
  =
> create another better one?
  >
  > The idea of creating a sequel to the r=
pg is one that I would agree
  > with. That would require several things to=
 happen:
  > 1) Changing the name of the RPG.
  > 2) Appropriate changes to=
 the website.
  > 3) A means to store all of everyone's previous characters=
 (don't
  > know about everyone else, but I don't want to lose the bio's of=
 all
  > my characters).
  > 4) New story (i have an idea, not necessarily =
for the story, but for
  > how we could create the story).
  > 5) A catalys=
t to start us all off (the story should provide that).
  > 6) Implementatio=
n of new rules, some of which have been, and are
  > being, discussed in th=
e login messageboard.
  > 7) other stuff that could be written if I wasn't =
so tired.
  >
  > All in all, since there are more people voting anti-resta=
rt that I'd
  > anticpated, I'll ask everyone a perhaps fate deciding quest=
ion:
  >
  > Would it be favourable to have a sequel instead of a restart?
=
  >
  >
  >
  > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2000@y...> wrote:
  >=
 > I'm agree with Soulstice, restart isn't good idea. All have good
  > > s=
tory-lines and good characters. Perhaps the best would be
  > eliminate
  >=
 > less importat characters of our story-line (every rpgers could
  > choic=
e
  > > at whom wants eliminate) and elimitante factions where are member
 =
 > > that aren't posting and join factions that have few characters
  > > p=
laying.
  > >
  > > That other way than restart.
  > >
  > >
  > >
  > > --=
- In nbwrpg@y..., "Narrator" <thecode@p...> wrote:
  > > > OOC: I at first =
wasn't sure if I could vote in this one. Not
  > only
  > > am I seemingly =
not too much an important part of this RPG, despite
  > > the general curre=
nt lack of members, and the fact that I've been
  > here
  > > for getting =
close to 2 years, but also I am not involved in this
  > > restart. I have =
very few characters. Characters that, if the RPG
  > is
  > > restarted, wi=
ll still be together (Insecticons, specifically), and
  > > therefore it wo=
uldn't harm me to vote yes. However, I don't think
  > I
  > > could vote y=
es, because I am apposed to restarting the RPG. I have
  > > decided to vot=
e no. It just doesn't make sense to me to end the
  > saga
  > > of Neo Bea=
st Wars. It's a great saga that we've worked hard over
  > the
  > > years =
to keep going. I don't think that we could suddenly pretend
  > it
  > > ne=
ver happened, I think it's impossible. Maybe if we ended it and
  > > start=
ed the sequel, I wouldn't mind so much, but otherwise, my
  > vote
  > > is=
 no. Thank you for reading this if you even did...
  > >
  > >
  > >
  > > =
